result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton J Hancock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence currently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton J Hancock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Joc-no longer inmate at Marquette County Jail
Per VWC - the victim recovered money from recovery company and the recovery company did not request restitution

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Colton J Hancock in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Colton J Hancock in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:27 AM. Burns - resolved - provides court with plea questionnaire - has not discussed the right to PH as defendant wants to get this matter taken care of. Court gives right of PH to defendant. Defendant agrees and wants to plead to. Burns - plead to only count - joint of 2 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year of ES - all concurrent to any prison time that the defendant is currently serving, conditions of ES: $20.00 restitution, and standard conditions. State agrees - has complied with victim notification requirements. Hancock agrees and pleads G. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - ask that any prison monies/funds that the defendant is entitled to be garnished by 25% to pay restitution. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Hancock makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 2 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement - concurrent to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving, followed by 1 year of ES. ES conditions include: costs - paid thru ES, $20.00 in restitution - to be paid with 25% of any prison funds/monies that the defendant is entitled to, submit DNA form, no possession of firearms and no voting rights, right to appeal, State has filed Information that is consistent with the complaint, eligible for both programs, Burns has no objection to that.
CJH - Inmate not here (Marquette County Jail)

Defendant Colton J Hancock not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:47 p.m. State indicates writ was done on 8/24 and is ample time for jail to get him. State requests $1000 warrant. Court orders bench warrant, body or $1000.00.

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:01 AM. State - believes the defendant is incarcerated somewhere. Burns - defendant is currently in the Walworth County Jail at this point, believes he will be writted back to Marquette County soon for a court hearing, he is being charged in 8 counties with felonies, asks for adjournment for a couple of weeks. Court would like the State to writ the defendant here. State - need two weeks for that. Court sets for AIA. Defendnat's notice given to Attorney Burns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
